thread.title: Jeremy Renner on fighting for equal pay: "Not my job"
thread.title_full: Jeremy Renner on fighting for equal pay: "Not my job"

title: Jeremy Renner on fighting for equal pay: "Not my job"
text:
By Andrea Park CBS News October 22, 2015, 5:43 PM Jeremy Renner says fighting for equal pay is "not my job" 
Actor Jeremy Renner arrives at the 72nd Golden Globe Awards in Beverly Hills, California January 11, 2015. Reuters/Mario Anzuoni More + 
How does Jeremy Renner feel about equal pay for women and men in Hollywood? It's not his problem, he says. 
After his "American Hustle" co-star Jennifer Lawrence penned an essay decrying Hollywood's wage gap between men and women, Renner told Business Insider that his job is simply to act. "American Hustle" director David O. Russell discusses the collaboration process of working with actors Christian Bale, Amy Adams, Bradley Cooper,... 
The publication asked Renner if he'd be willing to negotiate alongside female co-stars in the future. 
"That's not my job," Renner said. "I don't know contracts and money and all that sort of stuff." 
He added that he fully supports actresses receiving equal pay, but he is more focused on developing as an actor. 
"I'm a performer and I know human behavior. When it comes to that sort of stuff I let other people deal with that," said "The Avengers" actor "I do what I'm good at, that's what I focus on." Â© 2015 CBS Interactive Inc. All Rights Reserved. Shares
